Detailed Description

template<class SetsType, class DataStructDB = Tatree_base<SetsType>>
class BinaryDB< SetsType, DataStructDB >

BinaryDB_base represents a binary relation, a transactionnal data bases.

This class is used to store in memory the transactional database for frequent itemsets mining. By default, the transactions are stored in a trie data structure (Tatree). First, the transactions are stored in a temporary data structure (matrix). From this structure, the frequent items are extracted and reordered. After this, the transactions are recontructed (without not frequent items and in increasing oreder of support) and inserted in the final data structure.

The template parameter SetsType is the type of the elements stored in the db. The template parameter DataStructDB is a container of sets to store the transactions in memory.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

BinaryDB< SetsType, DataStructDB >::BinaryDB (  InputFormat &  format,
bool  inverbose = false
)  [inline]
 

Constructor.

The constructor transfer the data from the input stream to a temporay data structure. The template parameter is a stream manipulator that input the data from the db.

InputIterator &  last,
int  nb = 1
)  [inline]
 

Push back a set of element.

This function insert a transaction in the final data structure. With default parameter, the template parameter represents the input iterators on the elements to insert in the data base.

Parameters:
first iterator on the first element
last iterator on the element after the last
nb the number of times the set is inserted

template<class SetsType, class DataStructDB = Tatree_base<SetsType>>
template<class Container>
void BinaryDB< SetsType, DataStructDB >::push_back (  Container &  setElement,
int  nb = 1
)  [inline]
 

Push back a set of element.

This function insert a transaction in the final data structure. With default parameter, this function corresponds to the classic push_back( ) function od STL container. The template parameter represents a container of element of type SetsType.

Parameters:
setElement the set of element to insert in the trie
nb the number of times the set is inserted
